terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions if needed.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet rather than installed locally.
Official records and documents that demonstrate adherence to regulatory standards, industry requirements, and legal obligations.
A unified system where all documents and information are stored in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple platforms.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, used for compliance verification and security purposes.
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and document management tasks without manual intervention.
A security method that restricts document access and editing permissions based on a user's role or position within an organization.
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for creating consistent documentation.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and update documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, ensuring everyone accesses the same accurate data.
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents or information from a documentation system or database.
Automated processes that route documents through designated reviewers and approvers before final publication or implementation.
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating food, drugs, medical devices, and packaging materials that come into contact with consumables.
International Organization for Standardization - a global body that develops and publishes international standards for quality, safety, and efficiency across various industries.
